t: John 5
The Healing at the Pool
Some*p time later, Jesus went up to Jerusalem for one of the Jewish festivals.
Now there is in Jerusalem near the Sheep Gate a pool, which in Aramaic is called Bethesda and which is surrounded by five covered colonnades.
Here a great number of disabled people used to lie—the blind, the lame, the paralyzed.
One who was there had been an invalid for thirty-eight years.
When Jesus saw him lying there and learned that he had been in this condition for a long time, he asked him, “Do*r you*r want*r to*r get*r well?”*r
“Sir,”*p the invalid replied, “I have no one to help me into the pool when the water is stirred. While I am trying to get in, someone else goes down ahead of me.”
Then*p Jesus said to him, “Get*r up!*r Pick*r up*r your*r mat*r and*r walk.”*r
At once the man was cured; he picked up his mat and walked. The*p day on which this took place was a Sabbath,
and so the Jewish leaders said to the man who had been healed, “It is the Sabbath; the law forbids you to carry your mat.”
But*p he replied, “The man who made me well said to me, ‘Pick*r up*r your*r mat*r and*r walk.’”*r
So*p they asked him, “Who is this fellow who told you to pick it up and walk?”
The*p man who was healed had no idea who it was, for Jesus had slipped away into the crowd that was there.
Later*p Jesus found him at the temple and said to him, “See,*r you*r are*r well*r again.*r Stop*r sinning*r or*r something*r worse*r may*r happen*r to*r you.”*r
The man went away and told the Jewish leaders that it was Jesus who had made him well.
The Authority of the Son
So,*p because Jesus was doing these things on the Sabbath, the Jewish leaders began to persecute him.
In his defense Jesus said to them, “My*r Father*r is*r always*r at*r his*r work*r to*r this*r very*r day,*r and*r I*r too*r am*r working.”*r
For this reason they tried all the more to kill him; not only was he breaking the Sabbath, but he was even calling God his own Father, making himself equal with God.

Jesus*p gave them this answer: “Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r the*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r by*r himself;*r he*r can*r do*r only*r what*r he*r sees*r his*r Father*r doing,*r because*r whatever*r the*r Father*r does*r the*r Son*r also*r does.*r
For*r the*r Father*r loves*r the*r Son*r and*r shows*r him*r all*r he*r does.*r Yes,*r and*r he*r will*r show*r him*r even*r greater*r works*r than*r these,*r so*r that*r you*r will*r be*r amazed.*r
For*r just*r as*r the*r Father*r raises*r the*r dead*r and*r gives*r them*r life,*r even*r so*r the*r Son*r gives*r life*r to*r whom*r he*r is*r pleased*r to*r give*r it.*r
Moreover,*r the*r Father*r judges*r no*r one,*r but*r has*r entrusted*r all*r judgment*r to*r the*r Son,*r
that*r all*r may*r honor*r the*r Son*r just*r as*r they*r honor*r the*r Father.*r Whoever*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Son*r does*r not*r honor*r the*r Father,*r who*r sent*r him.*r

“Very*rp truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r whoever*r hears*r my*r word*r and*r believes*r him*r who*r sent*r me*r has*r eternal*r life*r and*r will*r not*r be*r judged*r but*r has*r crossed*r over*r from*r death*r to*r life.*r

Very*r truly*r I*r tell*r you,*r a*r time*r is*r coming*r and*r has*r now*r come*r when*r the*r dead*r will*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God*r and*r those*r who*r hear*r will*r live.*r
For*r as*r the*r Father*r has*r life*r in*r himself,*r so*r he*r has*r granted*r the*r Son*r also*r to*r have*r life*r in*r himself.*r
And*r he*r has*r given*r him*r authority*r to*r judge*r because*r he*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r Man.*r
“Do*rp not*r be*r amazed*r at*r this,*r for*r a*r time*r is*r coming*r when*r all*r who*r are*r in*r their*r graves*r will*r hear*r his*r voice*r
and*r come*r out—those*r who*r have*r done*r what*r is*r good*r will*r rise*r to*r live,*r and*r those*r who*r have*r done*r what*r is*r evil*r will*r rise*r to*r be*r condemned.*r
By*r myself*r I*r can*r do*r nothing;*r I*r judge*r only*r as*r I*r hear,*r and*r my*r judgment*r is*r just,*r for*r I*r seek*r not*r to*r please*r myself*r but*r him*r who*r sent*r me.*r
Testimonies About Jesus
“If*rp I*r testify*r about*r myself,*r my*r testimony*r is*r not*r true.*r
There*r is*r another*r who*r testifies*r in*r my*r favor,*r and*r I*r know*r that*r his*r testimony*r about*r me*r is*r true.*r
“You*rp have*r sent*r to*r John*r and*r he*r has*r testified*r to*r the*r truth.*r
Not*r that*r I*r accept*r human*r testimony;*r but*r I*r mention*r it*r that*r you*r may*r be*r saved.*r
John*r was*r a*r lamp*r that*r burned*r and*r gave*r light,*r and*r you*r chose*r for*r a*r time*r to*r enjoy*r his*r light.*r

“I*rp have*r testimony*r weightier*r than*r that*r of*r John.*r For*r the*r works*r that*r the*r Father*r has*r given*r me*r to*r finish—the*r very*r works*r that*r I*r am*r doing—testify*r that*r the*r Father*r has*r sent*r me.*r
And*r the*r Father*r who*r sent*r me*r has*r himself*r testified*r concerning*r me.*r You*r have*r never*r heard*r his*r voice*r nor*r seen*r his*r form,*r
nor*r does*r his*r word*r dwell*r in*r you,*r for*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r the*r one*r he*r sent.*r
You*r study*r the*r Scriptures*r diligently*r because*r you*r think*r that*r in*r them*r you*r have*r eternal*r life.*r These*r are*r the*r very*r Scriptures*r that*r testify*r about*r me,*r
yet*r you*r refuse*r to*r come*r to*r me*r to*r have*r life.*r
“I*rp do*r not*r accept*r glory*r from*r human*r beings,*r
but*r I*r know*r you.*r I*r know*r that*r you*r do*r not*r have*r the*r love*r of*r God*r in*r your*r hearts.*r
I*r have*r come*r in*r my*r Father’s*r name,*r and*r you*r do*r not*r accept*r me;*r but*r if*r someone*r else*r comes*r in*r his*r own*r name,*r you*r will*r accept*r him.*r
How*r can*r you*r believe*r since*r you*r accept*r glory*r from*r one*r another*r but*r do*r not*r seek*r the*r glory*r that*r comes*r from*r the*r only*r God?*r
“But*rp do*r not*r think*r I*r will*r accuse*r you*r before*r the*r Father.*r Your*r accuser*r is*r Moses,*r on*r whom*r your*r hopes*r are*r set.*r
If*r you*r believed*r Moses,*r you*r would*r believe*r me,*r for*r he*r wrote*r about*r me.*r
But*r since*r you*r do*r not*r believe*r what*r he*r wrote,*r how*r are*r you*r going*r to*r believe*r what*r I*r say?”*r
